p: Seed development ensures the continuation of next generation, which is initiated after fertilization and terminates with breakage of seed dormancy or germination (Huijser & Schmid, 2011; Le et al., 2007). Seed provides the primary source of dietary intake in humans and livestock (Nambara & Nonogaki, 2012; Sabelli & Larkins, 2015). To fulfill the requirements of the exponentially increasing population, crop yield needs to be increased proportionately. Numerous studies have been performed to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying seed development (Jones & Vodkin, 2013; Kurdyukov et al., 2014; Le et al., 2010; Rangan et al., 2017; Xu et al., 2012).
